website_summaries.verdict: A great lathe for woodturners just starting out – one that is solid and versatile enough for more complex jobs. Users will likely upgrade in time, but they’ll keep this one around.
pros: Wide speed range, with digital variable control that removes the need to change or adjust belts
Solid and heavy at 160 lbs., it must be mounted on a sturdy surface, and runs smoothly for woodwork
cons: Length is just 21 inches, but a 42-inch bed extension is available
Drive center and tail stock center arrived out of alignment on some units, possibly due to damage in shipping, but a skilled user can correct
Tool rests aren’t smooth, and spindles are occasionally reported out of alignment

customer_reviews.title: Good at this price.
customer_reviews.text: All in all a decent lathe, but a bit of a hassle getting the right extension with the proper leg set to fit. Decided to call Jet to get things sorted out, and whoa.....not a very good experience dealing with them....hence the 4 stars. I could have avoided them for help, and maybe you should.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Tulloch

customer_reviews.title: The digital variable speed control is amazing and makes working with the lathe incredibly easy
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the JET JWL_1221VS from Amazon and received it on-time as usual. The Styrofoam inside the box was severely damaged and I was concerned that the lathe had been dropped. The tail-stock was not tightened however, and had caused the damage to the Styrofoam. As other reviews on here, the drive center and tail stock center were slightly out of alignment which was fixed by loosening the adjustment screws underneath and shimming it over. The digital variable speed control is amazing and makes working with the lathe incredibly easy. There is no guess work on the speed as the read out tells you exactly what it is. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this lathe
customer_reviews.text: I Received this lathe in the mail a few weeks ago and absolutely love it. The digital display is so nice to have, smooth and comes with everything I needed. I may get a larger faceplate eventually but this one works for now because it has 8 holes to secure the wood rather than just 4. Constructed very well, very solid. I'm not having an issue with the rest guard turning or sliding on me like other reviews said but maybe it will in time? I also don't have an issue with the tail stock moving, the lock works great.

customer_reviews.title: Very poor lathe
customer_reviews.text: The lathe has had nothing but issues since it was purchased. First, after only using it three times, the reverse quit working. Then trouble lights started going off. Now, the least bit of vibration sets off an E4 notice that shuts the lathe off. Customer service made one attempt to help out by sending a new control panel which I had to install. It did not solve the problem. I will contact customer service again tomorrow and will see what they would like to do.

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back.

I have not reordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: Willard N. Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Came well packed with little to assemble. A stong person can handle the unpacking. If in doubt use help. It is heavy. That helps in use. It is solid and vibration is minimal. The electronic speed control seems to be a little quirky and sometimes speeds up suddenly. It is a good lathe but truthfully I wish I had spent another $2000 and bought a full size lathe. But you get what you pay for and this is a good midi lathe for $700.

The tail stock body locking mechanism likes to drift loose and often times I can actually see the handle turning without and pressure or vibration. The lathe is off when I've seen this behavior and it is even worse when the lathe is on. I have been able to smack the handle to be much tighter and it seems to be ok for now. I will need to reach out to Jet to figure out what the issue is.

customer_reviews.title: Great lathe
